intro: Bulbinella brevifolia, commonly known as the rock lily, is a small, flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its flowers are small and usually white or pale blue, with a delicate appearance. The plant is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
